Title: How To Be Civilized Online
Book Description: The internet allows us to express our opinions- good and bad- anonymously and instantaneously.  Learn how to be a better cyber-citizen.

Title: Social Media for Writers
Presenters: David Erik Nelson, Andrea Johnson, Michael W. Lucas, Christopher Purrett, Alex Kourvo
Book Description: What social media trends does a writer building their web footprint need to understand? What are some Dos and Don'ts?

Title: Editing for Your Spouse/Partner/BFF/Pet
Presenters: Scott Favre, Clif Flynt, Janice Leach, Jim Leach
Book Description: 'Can you read this and tell me what you think?' is a question to test any relationship.  We will learn some ways to navigate that communications mine-field while musing on the nature of editing- the care and feeding of your larval writer and some small- practical steps towards upping our editing game.

Title: Dealing with the Paranormal
Book Description: Come and learn how to remove unwanted things/beings from your life- home and being.  This presentation will include discussion of different practices and spells and ingredients that help to remove paranormal annoyances.  After ghost hunting and magically cleansing many homes- I have found different things that work to remove attachments and parasitic paranormals.

Title: Live Podcast: Getting Drunk with Shannon & Maggie
Book Description: Shannon and Maggie are BFF’s and they (used to) drink- a lot. Join us for our 3rd time at Penguicon. Hilarity will ensue- we will drink- eat cheese- and discuss the latest events in life and entertainment. Audience members will be able to submit questions to be answered live during the session directly- during the recording- to Shannon and Maggie or via Twitter at @ShannonsParty and @BrainOfMaggie

Title: Intro to Needle Felting
Book Description: Needle Felting! You get to stab things! In this panel- we'll needle-felt a simple flat penguin- suitable for making into pendant/pin/whatever. Materials will be provided.

Title: Emulators and Emulation: Emulating a Trip Through Craig's Childhood, One Machine At a Time
Book Description: Emulating a trip through Craig's childhood- one machine at a time. Desktop computers today don't have any soul. Sure you have your Linux and your Macintosh and your 'Windows' but it's all pretty much the same hardware underneath. Why not put those gigahertz to use and emulate the hardware and software of yester-year? Craig Maloney will give a tour of his childhood by showing us how to (legally) run such computers as the Atari 800XL- the Commodore Amiga- PET and C64- the Sinclair ZX series- and even some arcade games. Amaze your friends by running a room-full of 1970s and 1980s technology on more capable hardware. It's a presentation you won't want to miss!

Title: Intro to Agile/Scrum
Book Description: What does it mean to be Agile?  Is it all marketing and hype or does this represent the future of software development?  We will explore fundamentals of Agile software development and focus primarily on the SCRUM framework.  We will discuss things like the element of Scrum- it’s roles- cadence and traditions- the elements of a good User Story-how to write an Acceptance Criteria- how to estimate User Stories using Scrum-Poker- release planning- a few useful Metrics- and follow-up with a few closing thoughts.

Title: BoF: Doctor Who
Book Description: Join fans of Doctor Who for an open discussion about all things timey-whimey. Birds of a Feather events are unmoderated.

Title: BoF: Sherlock
Book Description: Join fans for an open discussion of the BBC powerhouse Sherlock. Birds of a Feather events are unmoderated.

Title: Dragons, Demons, and the Laundry
Presenters: Christian Klaver, Robert Kroese, Michael Cieslak, Cathrynne Valente
Book Description: With Urban Fantasy being such an enormous field- how do you keep the sense of wonder in magical spells- fantastic creatures and other mystical phenomenon. Is this required and what is the cost if it's missing? Do characters look differently at magic if it's used to handle mundane tasks and what does this mean to the setting?

Title: Cryptozoology and the Paranormal in the Great Lakes
Book Description: Come learn about and discuss cryptozoology and the paranormal wonders of the Great Lakes region.

Title: Webcomics 101-Logistics
Book Description: Did you catch Part 1 (of 3) of the amazing Erika Wagner and Laura Cascos's Webcomics 101 panel? If you did...awesome! If you didn't...off to detention for you! Before you go to detention though- be sure to catch part 2 and learn about logistics and their importance in the Webcomic medium!

Title: Electrifying Sex: From Quack to Kink
Book Description: What does high voltage and foreplay have in common? What is a TENS unit good for except back pain?  Find out these answers and more with this fun presentation and demonstration. Learn about violet wands- TENS units- and more! Come and try out an electric toy.

Title: Polyamory and Kink
Presenters: Jillian Hawkins, Darek Hawkins, Ciaran Kingans, Ash Sexton, David Chase
Book Description: Come and find out how how poly can be different with a D/s dynamic.

Title: Gender and Geek Culture
Presenters: Wendy Carson, Hannah Davis, John Belden
Book Description: How do we eliminate the 'women aren't real [fill in the blank] sterotype?  Are we doing everything we can to bring more people into the geek fold?

Title: Penguicon 2017 Planning Meeting
Presenters: Scott Kennedy, Daniel Dugan, Nuri Gocay, Cylithria Dubois, Amanda Long-Adams, Amanda Robinson, Miranda Webster, Jessica Roland, Julie, Winningham
Book Description: Making a successful Penguicon requires at least a year of organizing- planning- and partying.  Do not skip the partying!  Join us for the first planning meeting with the 2017 ConChair- Cylithria DuBois- and her selected Con Committee. If you want to contribute to Penguicon next year- or you just want to see how we make it happen- join us!

Title: Cosplay Hacks Part 2
Book Description: Do you have a great costume idea but can't find a pattern or the ability to make it? I have some great advice and techniques that will help you get through it all. We will spend more time addressing specific questions and needs of the audience in a hands-on way. Part 2 of 2- attendance of Part 1 is not required.

Title: Conclave 40 Feedback and Announcements
Book Description: It's the 40th year for the Conclave SF convention in December- and we want to hear from you!  Find out what is going on in Conclave- bring us your ideas and thoughts- and contribute to the growth of the convention.  We hope to see everyone there and expect big things this year with plenty of surprises!

Title: Where Did the Heroes Go?
Presenters: Jay Maynard, Eric S. Raymond, Jon Davis, Stewart Sternberg
Book Description: Science fiction and fantasy were once known for stories with strong- capable heroes and heroines. We take a look at heroes and what's happened to them lately.
